definitions.definition: To enter a place by force or illicit means.
definitions.example: Someone broke in and stole his radio.

definitions.definition: To cause (something, or someone, new) to function more naturally through use or wear
definitions.example: These shoes will be more comfortable after I have broken them in.

definitions.definition: (of a horse) To tame; make obedient; to train to follow orders of the owner.
To interrupt one's conversation; speak before another person has finished speaking.
